text: [Music]
job interview skills a program to master
the difficult stages and situations in a
job interview step 4
role and salary negotiation salary
negotiation is one of the most delicate
part of the whole job search process and
it is at this stage most of the
candidates inadvertently disqualify
themselves you have a job offer in hand
how much leeway do you have to negotiate
salary and other conditions of
employment the answer ranges from not
much to a lot one key factor is the
discussion of salary benefits and
working conditions that occurred during
the interview process law of negotiation
you have likely shared your current or
most recent salary with the potential
employer the potential employer may have
shared the salary range for the position
with you don't count on this however
since employers don't want to lay their
cards first on the table as in any
negotiation you should also have a very
clear picture of your objectives in this
case your minimum salary figure
calculate how much you need how much you
want and how much you would really like
employers may not be interested in how
much it costs you to live but if you
talk in concrete terms it immediately
becomes obvious that you're not being
frivolous in the negotiation always make
it a point to check out the industry
average the interview process does not
finish at the concluding handshake there
will be at least a couple of follow-up
discussions specifically around your
position or title and salary be prepared
for the upcoming rounds by clearly
knowing too
what level you are willing to negotiate
and what could be the potential tipping
point of your employer step 5
wrapping up the discussion and follow-up
wrapping up the discussion and follow-up
analyze the interview how did it go
what did you learn what was your
impression of the organization and the
interview sum up the key points of the
discussion with the interviewer and
reiterate why you are best qualified for
the position interviewed for thank the
interviewer for his or her time and
understand the next steps in the process
is there a follow-up round to this
interview would you be contacting or
should you follow up do you need to send
any additional information etc if there
are any questions that you need to ask
the interviewer this is the time to ask
them if additional information or
materials are requested verify that it
is being forwarded ensure you do not
share or forward any information that
may be confidential to your current role
or employer it is not appropriate to say
that the requested information is
confidential and cannot be shared with
the interviewer when appropriate
follow-up interviewers often tell you
how long it will take before a decision
is made
if the stated amount of time passes
without them contacting you you may
contact them to express your continued
interest in the position and ask about
the status finally always ask for the
interviewers a business card so you have
all the correct information for sending
your thank-you letter
this was a demonstration of video for
job interview skills for complete
program visit us at let's talk company
dot in if you like this video
kindly share your comments which will
encourage just to make more videos for
you you can also subscribe to our
YouTube channel by clicking subscribe
button just above this video thank you
for watching us take care
